artist: Designer: William Gray Purcell; E. L. Sharretts (working for Pittsburgh Plate Glass Co.)
creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
life_date: William Gray Purcell, Designer, American, 1880–1965; E. L. Sharretts (working for Pittsburgh Plate Glass Co.), American
object_name: Art-glass panel for a bay window, one of six
portfolio: From the George W. Stricker house, Minneapolis, Minnesota
text: This panel, along with the biplane window across the gallery, were part of a remodeling for George W. Stricker in 1909 and are probably Purcell's first foray into art-glass windows. Although Purcell produced a house design for Stricker in 1910, it was never built.
title: Art-glass panel for a bay window, one of six
